intro: Centrolepis polygyna, commonly known as the mountain centrolepis, is a unique plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Podostomata, which includes aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, ribbon-like leaves and its ability to thrive in fast-flowing streams and rivers. It has a short stem with few branches and is often found growing on rocks or submerged in water. Due to its specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
